The Jon Peterson Scholarship

Special Education Services at No Cost to Families

What the JPSN Scholarship Provides

  • Helps K-12 Ohio students with an IEP
  • Access to special education from approved providers
  • Awards set by disability category
  • No family income cap

Who Was Jon Peterson?

Jon Peterson (1953-2019) was an Ohio public servant and disability advocate. The state created the JPSN Scholarship in 2012 to honor his work.

Funding for FY 2025

$9,585 UP TO $32,445

DEPENDING ON CATEGORY

How to Apply in 7 Steps

  1. Confirm your child has an active IEP and is an Ohio resident.
  2. Choose a state-approved Jon Peterson Provider (like The Reading Roost).
  3. Notify your public school district of your intent to apply.
  4. Complete parent forms provided by your provider.
  5. Gather required documents (IEP, proof of residency, birth certificate).
  6. Provider submits the application through the Ohio Department of Education.
  7. Once approved, services begin at no cost to you!
